timeline.title: The Birth of Artificial Intelligence
timeline.summary: The term 'Artificial Intelligence' was first coined at the Dartmouth Conference organized by John McCarthy. This marked the official beginning of AI as a field of research.
timeline.keyInsight: AI established as a formal academic discipline with the goal of creating machines that can 'think'.

timeline.title: ELIZA and Early Natural Language Processing
timeline.summary: Joseph Weizenbaum created ELIZA, one of the first chatbots that could simulate conversation with users, albeit in a very primitive way. It marked early explorations into natural language processing.
timeline.keyInsight: Early demonstration that machines could simulate understanding human language, though without true comprehension.

timeline.title: First AI Winter Begins
timeline.summary: After initial enthusiasm, AI research funding was significantly cut as promised breakthroughs failed to materialize. This period became known as the first 'AI Winter'.
timeline.keyInsight: Early expectations for AI were unrealistically high, leading to disappointment and funding cuts.

timeline.title: Revival of AI Through Expert Systems
timeline.summary: The success of expert systems like XCON, which helped configure computer orders for Digital Equipment Corporation, demonstrated practical commercial applications for AI.
timeline.keyInsight: AI found commercial success when focused on narrow, well-defined problems rather than general intelligence.

timeline.title: IBM's Deep Blue Defeats World Chess Champion
timeline.summary: IBM's Deep Blue became the first computer to defeat a reigning world chess champion, Garry Kasparov, in a match, demonstrating the growing capabilities of AI in specific domains.
timeline.keyInsight: Specialized AI systems could now surpass human champions in complex strategic games, though using different methods than human thinking.

timeline.title: The Deep Learning Revolution Begins
timeline.summary: Geoffrey Hinton published a landmark paper on deep learning algorithms, which would later revolutionize the field of AI by enabling much more powerful neural networks.
timeline.keyInsight: New training methods made multi-layer neural networks practical, setting the stage for dramatic advances in AI capabilities.

timeline.title: ImageNet Competition Breakthrough
timeline.summary: Alex Krizhevsky, Ilya Sutskever, and Geoffrey Hinton's deep neural network dramatically improved image recognition accuracy in the ImageNet competition, demonstrating the power of deep learning.
timeline.source: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems
timeline.keyInsight: Deep neural networks proved dramatically better at computer vision tasks than previous approaches, kickstarting the modern AI boom.

timeline.title: AlphaGo Defeats World Go Champion
timeline.summary: Google DeepMind's AlphaGo defeated world Go champion Lee Sedol, a feat previously thought to be decades away due to the game's complexity and intuitive nature.
timeline.keyInsight: AI demonstrated mastery of intuitive strategy previously thought to require human-like understanding, raising questions about future capabilities.

timeline.title: First AI-Generated Art Auctioned at Christie's
timeline.summary: The artwork 'Portrait of Edmond de Belamy,' created by an algorithm developed by the art collective Obvious, was sold at Christie's auction house for $432,500, marking AI's entry into creative domains.
timeline.keyInsight: AI began to enter creative domains previously thought to be uniquely human, raising questions about the nature of creativity and art.

timeline.title: GPT-2 and Concerns About Misuse of Language Models
timeline.summary: OpenAI initially restricted the release of its GPT-2 language model due to concerns about potential misuse, sparking debates about AI safety and ethical deployment.
timeline.keyInsight: Advanced language models raised new concerns about AI safety, misinformation potential, and the ethics of powerful generative models.

timeline.title: AlphaFold Solves Protein Folding Problem
timeline.summary: DeepMind's AlphaFold system achieved a breakthrough in solving the protein folding problem, with potential to revolutionize drug discovery and biological research.
timeline.keyInsight: AI demonstrated ability to solve fundamental scientific problems that had resisted traditional approaches for decades.

timeline.title: DALL-E and the Rise of Multimodal AI
timeline.summary: OpenAI's DALL-E demonstrated the ability to generate images from text descriptions, showing advances in multimodal AI systems that work across different types of information.
timeline.keyInsight: AI systems began effectively working across multiple modalities (text and images), showing emergent creative capabilities.

timeline.title: ChatGPT and Mainstream Adoption of Generative AI
timeline.summary: OpenAI's release of ChatGPT brought conversational AI to mainstream attention, with over a million users in its first week and widespread adoption across industries.
timeline.keyInsight: Large language models became accessible to general public, triggering widespread adoption and concerns about economic disruption.

timeline.title: Global Calls for AI Regulation
timeline.summary: Following rapid advances in AI capabilities, governments worldwide began developing regulatory frameworks to address safety concerns, with the EU's AI Act and the US Executive Order on AI.
timeline.keyInsight: Concerns about AI risks led to first major governmental regulatory efforts, seeking to balance innovation with safety.

timeline.title: Multimodal AI Assistants in Daily Life
timeline.summary: AI assistants capable of understanding and generating text, images, audio, and video became integrated into daily life through smartphones, home devices, and workplace tools.
timeline.keyInsight: AI became deeply integrated into daily life, with capabilities spanning multiple sensory modalities and increasingly personalized assistance.
